qas.question: Where does line T1 run from?

answers.text: Pont de Bezons to Porte de Versailles

qas.question: How many lines are in the rail network?

context: In addition, the Paris region is served by a light rail network of <a2_0>nine<a2_0/> lines, the tramway: Line T1 runs from <a0_0>Asnières-Gennevilliers to Noisy-le-Sec<a0_0/>, line T2 runs from <a1_0>Pont de Bezons to Porte de Versailles<a1_0/>, line T3a runs from Pont du Garigliano to Porte de Vincennes, line T3b runs from Porte de Vincennes to Porte de la Chapelle, line T5 runs from <a3_0>Saint-Denis to Garges-Sarcelles<a3_0/>, line T6 runs from Châtillon to Velizy, line T7 runs from Villejuif to Athis-Mons, line T8 runs from Saint-Denis to Épinay-sur-Seine and Villetaneuse, all of which are operated by the <a4_0>Régie Autonome des Transports Parisiens<a4_0/>, and line T4 runs from Bondy RER to Aulnay-sous-Bois, which is operated by the state rail carrier SNCF. Five new light rail lines are currently in various stages of development.
